intro: Coussapoa glaberrima, commonly known as the glabrous cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a fruit similar to the cacao pod, which is used in traditional medicine and has a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in humid, shady environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native habitat.
